message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper is about curriculum learning in neural machine translation, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses Bayesian optimization, which is a common technique in machine learning and optimization, suggesting that it could also be categorized as cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves optimizing multiple tasks simultaneously, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also uses neural networks, which are commonly used in computer vision, suggesting that it could also be categorized as cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper involves optimizing the weighting of different data selection scores, which could fall under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
